content: Is there a good word for the item that is identified by the HirId? The CrateNum identifies the crate and the DefId identifies a definition within the crate, what would you call what the HirId identifies within a definition?
An HIR node?
That is a possibility
though I think the HirId is different from the NodeId
NodeId is for AST nodes
ah
yeah HirId is "HIR (node) ID"
we could rename both of them to reflect that better shrug
lots of room for improvement
cool - I appreciate the help!

Would anyone be willing to take a look at my slides for the talk where I explain this? (I will be presenting it at Rusty Days next week). Right now I'm just looking for technical accuracy, rather than opinions on the styling of the slides (which I will do after I get the content locked in)
sure, sounds fun! btw if I had some slides I'd probably go ask @nikomatsakis but he's also really busy all the time :sweat_smile:
idk if there's a place where you'd be guaranteed relevant people will see it
(in general, I mean. I only see some stuff because I'm randomly clicking in the Zulip UI)
lol - I already have a run through scheduled with him later this week :)
@eddyb what is a good email for you?
what for? PM works :P
I'm not willing to make the google drive link public just yet
other than that, if you must, it should be listed on https://github.com/eddyb
(you can get the more personal email from git but it gets enough spam as it is so I try to not "say it out loud" where possible :P)
sharing the deck with you (if that doesn't work, let me know, I'll export it into a PDF and send you that)
it will work if I remember to use /u/1 instead of /u/0 (or switch in the UI) :P
Sent to your email :)
looking now :D
thanks for reminding me that I haven't read TWiR in ages :(
I should start again but it can be overwhelming, so much stuff happening
I also publish at 10 min or so podcast summing it up every week :)
On the Rustacean Station https://rustacean-station.org/episode/023-twir-348/
I would also welcome any suggestions on where it might be good to expand it - it's currently running about 20 min (just under, actually) and I have a 45 min slot
oh, the talk you sent me the slides for?
you can probably easily add more stuff like name resolution and type-checking/inference, if you want to more closely represent the "pipeline" of the compiler
